intro: Asplenium filix-femina var. purpureum, commonly known as the Purple Maidenhair Fern, is a variant of the common maidenhair fern characterized by its striking purple foliage. It is a terrestrial fern that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in temperate regions. The plant has delicate, lace-like fronds that are often arching or pendulous, contributing to its ornamental appeal. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is known for its ability to tolerate low light conditions. The varietal name 'purpureum' refers to the distinctive purple coloration of its leaves, which sets it apart from other variants of the species.
